overview:
Glen Kacher founded Light Street Capital Management in May of 2010.

Glen Kacher joined Integral as a Managing Director in January 1998. At Integral, Glen leads both private and public investments primarily in the Internet, software, Software as a Service, information security, computer services, and consumer technology markets. Glen is frequently quoted in the financial press regarding industry developments. Prior to joining Integral, Glen spent four years with Tiger Management as a research analyst and consultant where he focused on investments in the hardware, software, and networking industries. While Glen was at Tiger, the company experienced rapid growth in assets under management, beginning at $3.5 billion and growing to over $12 billion. Tiger was one of the largest and most respected hedge funds of its time. Glen also worked in the marketing department at Calico Commerce, one of Integral’s former portfolio companies.

Glen earned a B.S. from the University of Virginia’s McIntire School of Commerce with Distinction, and an M.B.A. from Stanford University’s Graduate School of Business.
